conclusion: Analyze the given velocity-time graphs for Car A and Car B, and understand the concept of tangents to these graphs.

Identify the tangent lines to the velocity-time graphs. The tangent line at a point on a velocity-time graph represents the instantaneous acceleration at that point. The tangent line to the graph at time t1 is the red line.
Determine the slope of the tangent line at t1. The slope of the tangent line is the derivative of the velocity with respect to time, which gives the acceleration at that point.
For Car A, the slope of the tangent line at t1 is the magnitude of the acceleration. Since the slope decreases from t1 to t2, the magnitude of the acceleration of Car A decreases.
For Car B, the slope of the tangent line at t1 is the magnitude of the acceleration. Since the slope increases from t1 to t2, the magnitude of the acceleration of Car B increases.
Conclude that the magnitude of the acceleration of Car A decreases, while the magnitude of the acceleration of Car B increases, as shown in the graph.
Match this conclusion with the given options. The options are: A. Car A's acceleration decreases. B. Car B's acceleration increases.
Since the tangent line at t1 represents the magnitude of the acceleration, and the slope of the tangent line increases for Car B, the correct option is B.
